mini biography: 'Chadwick Boseman' (qv) is an American actor. He is known for his portrayal of T'Challa / Black Panther in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (since 2016), particularly in _Black Panther (2018)_ (qv), and for his starring roles in as 'Jackie Robinson' (qv) in _42 (2013)_ (qv), 'James Brown' (qv) in _Get on Up (2014)_ (qv), and 'Thurgood Marshall' (qv) in _Marshall (2017)_ (qv).He also starred in The Express (2008), Draft Day (2014), and Message from the King (2016).::Pedro Borges
trade mark: Best known for his portrayal of individuals from real-life
trivia: As a playwright, his script for "Deep Azure," performed at the Congo Square Theatre Company in Chicago, Illinois, was nominated for a 2006 Joseph Jefferson Award for New Work.
A graduate of both Howard University in Washington, DC and the British American Dramatic Academy at Oxford, England.
Grew up in Anderson, S.C., where he excelled in basketball. At age 31, he still plays pick-up games, and also boxes.
Denzel Washington paid for 'Chadwick Boseman' (qv)'s tuition at Oxford University.
Son of Carolyn (Mattress) and Leroy Boseman.
